page.title: 08VIOLIN MAKING ON SCORAIG
page.content:
VIOLIN MAKING ON SCORAIG AT 31st MAY.
THERE ARE 2 VIOLIN MAKERS ON SCORAIG-- A FULL TIME LUTHIER,THE OTHER STILL A STUDENT.THE EXPERT MAKES MOST OF HIS OWN TOOLS--GOUGES,CHISELS,TINY KNIVES, CLAMPS,SCRAPERS AND SMALL PLANES. IT TAKES ABOUT 5 WEEKS TO MAKE A VIOLIN WORKING FULL TIME.FOR THE FRONT HE USES SPRUCE;FOR THE BACK AND NECK MAPLE AND SYCAMORE;EBONY FOR THE FINGERBOARD;EBONY,ROSE OR BOXWOOD FOR THE PEGS AND TAIL PIECE.THE VIOLINS ARE VARNISHED WITH COLOURED VARNISH.IT IS IMPORTANT FOR THIER APPEARANCE AND PROTECTION.THERE ARE USUALLY BETWEEN 5 AND 10 COATS OF VARNISH WHICH CAN TAKE BETWEEN ONE AND 15 DAYS TO DRY. THERE IS ALSO A MAKER OF CHINRESTS. SHE MAKES THEM ALL DIFFERENT SHAPES,SIZES AND COLOURS ACCORDING TO THE WOOD USED
